sen.j: 東洋拓殖株式会社（とうようたくしょくかぶしきがいしゃ）は、大日本帝国時代の朝鮮の植民地事業を進めることを目的として設立された特殊会社である。
sen.e: Toyo Takushoku Kabushiki Gaisha was a special company established for the purpose of carrying forward colonial enterprises in Korea during the era of the Great Empire of Japan.
Toyo Takushoku Kabushiki Gaisha was a special company established for the purpose of carrying forward colonial enterprises in Korea during the era of the Great Empire of Japan.
Toyo Takushoku Kabushiki Gaisha was a special company established for the purpose of carrying forward colonial enterprises in Korea during the era of the Great Empire of Japan.

sen.j: 1908年（明治41）12月18日、東洋拓殖株式会社法（東拓法）を根拠法として、大韓帝国政府と日韓民間資本の共同出資などにより設立された。
sen.e: On December 18, 1908, it was jointly established by the government of the Korean Empire and the private capital of Japan and Korea based on Toyo Takushoku Kabushiki Gaisha Law (Totaku Law).
On December 18, 1908, it was jointly established by the government of the Korean Empire and the private capital of Japan and Korea based on Toyo Takushoku Kabushiki Gaisha Law (Totaku Law).
On December 18, 1908, it was jointly established by the government of the Korean Empire and the private capital of Japan and Korea based on Toyo Takushoku Kabushiki Gaisha Law (Totaku Law).

sen.j: 初代総裁は宇佐川一正（中将）。
sen.e: The first president was KAZUMASA Usagawa (Rank: lieutenant general).
The first president was Kazumasa USAGAWA (Rank: lieutenant general).
The first president was Kazumasa USAGAWA (Rank: lieutenant general).

sen.j: 当初は漢城（韓国併合後、京城府に改名）（現在のソウル特別市）に本店を置いた。
sen.e: Its head office was initially located at Hanseong (Keijo as it was renamed upon the annexation of Korea, and Seoul Special City as it is known today).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Its head office was initially located at Hanseong (Keijo as it was renamed upon the annexation of Korea, and Seoul Special City as it is known today).
Its head office was initially located at Hanseong (Keijo as it was renamed upon the annexation of Korea, and Seoul Special City as it is known today).

sen.j: 朝鮮の土地5700町 (単位)を所有して、日本からの移民と開拓をその事業として掲げた。
sen.e: It owned 5,700 cho (approx.5,700 hectares) of Korean land and engaged in immigration and exploitation by the Japanese.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It owned the land of 5,700 cho (approx.5,700 hectares) in Korea and engaged in immigration and development by the Japanese.
sen.cmt: 移民と開拓 immigration and exploitation by the Japanese --> immigration and development by the Japanese、としました。Reclamationは議論の余地のある語かもしれないのでやめましたが Immigration and exploitationでは意味が変わると思います。
sen.e: It owned the land of 5,700 cho (approx.5,700 hectares) in Korea and engaged in immigration and development by the Japanese.

sen.j: 会社発足当初から、政府の補助金も受けて土地の買収を進めた。
sen.e: Since the time of its foundation, the company proceeded with purchase of the land with financial help from the national government.
Since the time of its foundation, the company proceeded with purchase of the land with financial help from the national government.
Since the time of its foundation, the company proceeded with purchase of the land with financial help from the national government.

sen.j: 土地調査事業（1910年～1918年）で日本が接収した土地のうちから1万1400町歩が現物出資される。
sen.e: 11,400 chobo (approx. 11,400 hectares) of the land that had been condemned by Japan based on the Comprehensive Land Survey in Korea (from 1910 to 1918) were portioned out as an investment in land.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: 11,400 chobo (approx. 11,400 hectares) of the land that had been condemned by Japan based on the Comprehensive Land Survey in Korea (from 1910 to 1918) were portioned out as an investment in kind.
sen.cmt: investment in land --> investment in kind
sen.e: 11,400 chobo (approx. 11,400 hectares) of the land that had been condemned by Japan based on the Comprehensive Land Survey in Korea (from 1910 to 1918) were portioned out as an investment in kind.

sen.j: これらが朝鮮農民の反発を受けて買収が停滞する。
sen.e: This sort of event caused deep resentment among the Korean farmers and the land acquisition was once aborted.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: This sort of event caused deep resentment among the Korean farmers and the land acquisition was once aborted.
This sort of event caused deep resentment among the Korean farmers and the land acquisition was once aborted.

sen.j: しかし、1919年には7万8000町歩(全耕作面積の約1.8%)を保有した。
sen.e: In 1919, however, the land owned by the company amounted to 78,000 hectares (equivalent to about 1.8 percent of the total acreage under cultivation).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In 1919, however, the land owned by the company amounted to 78,000 hectares (equivalent to about 1.8 percent of the total acreage under cultivation).
In 1919, however, the land owned by the company amounted to 78,000 hectares (equivalent to about 1.8 percent of the total acreage under cultivation).

sen.j: 同社の日本人移民事業は挫折したが、接収した土地で朝鮮民族を寄生地主制として働かせ、地主兼金融業を中心業務とするようになった。
sen.e: Although the immigration project of the company fell through, it placed the focus on land-owning and money-lending businesses making Korean people work in the condemned land under Kisei Jinushi Sei (the landownership in the period of the establishment of the Japanese capitalism).

Although the immigration project of the company fell through, it placed the focus on land-owning and money-lending businesses making Korean people work in the condemned land under Kisei Jinushi Sei (the landownership in the period of the establishment of the Japanese capitalism).

Although the immigration project of the company fell through, it placed the focus on land-owning and money-lending businesses making Korean people work in the condemned land under Kisei Jinushi Sei (the landownership in the period of the establishment of the Japanese capitalism).

sen.j: そのため、日本の敗戦に至るまで日本統治時代の朝鮮における最大の地主となる。
sen.e: Consequently, it became the largest landowner in Korea under Japanese rule during the time until Japan was defeated in the war.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Consequently, it became the largest landowner in Korea under Japanese rule during the time until Japan was defeated in the war.
Consequently, it became the largest landowner in Korea under Japanese rule during the time until Japan was defeated in the war.

sen.j: 1937年には小作人7万8667人を擁した。
sen.e: 78,667 people farmed the land as tenants in 1937.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: 78,667 people farmed the land as tenants in 1937.
78,667 people farmed the land as tenants in 1937.

sen.j: また、天皇家が同社の株式を所有していたことも含め、名実とも日本の朝鮮経営の中心となった。
sen.e: Furthermore, it became the center of Japanese colonial administration in Korea both nominally and virtually as symbolized by the fact that the Imperial Family owned the stock of the company.
Furthermore, it became the center of Japanese colonial administration in Korea both nominally and virtually as symbolized by the fact that the Imperial Family owned the stock of the company.
Furthermore, it became the center of Japanese colonial administration in Korea both nominally and virtually as symbolized by the fact that the Imperial Family owned the stock of the company.

sen.j: 1917年に東拓法が改正され、本店が東京に移される。
sen.e: Due to the revision of the Totaku Law in 1917, the head office was moved to Tokyo.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Due to the revision of the Totaku Law in 1917, the head office was moved to Tokyo.
Due to the revision of the Totaku Law in 1917, the head office was moved to Tokyo.

sen.j: それと共に満州、モンゴル、華北、南洋諸島にまでその営業範囲を広げた。
sen.e: At the same time, its area of business was expanded to include Manchuria, Mongolia, North China and the South Sea Islands.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: At the same time, its area of business was expanded to include Manchuria, Mongolia, North China and the South Sea Islands.
At the same time, its area of business was expanded to include Manchuria, Mongolia, North China and the South Sea Islands.
